title: Great job

author: David R
comment: As a compass it floats over any apps or home screen.   You can let it float above your gps navigation map like Google Maps or Waze or Here for example.    It hangs when I try to do "Location and Weather" but I'll continue this review while considering this app to be only a compass.  This floating compass is especially useful because it works even when the screen is vertical (either landscape or portrait), by continuing to track what the result would be if you were to lay the device back down.  Unfortunately this compass shows only magnetic north, not true north (where I live the difference is about 13 degrees, which can sometimes be quite noticeable).   Also be careful not to open the app while the existing floating compass is still present, as the app will hang and crash when you try to close both of them.

reply.author: Geeks Empire
reply.content:
Thanks for Rating & Review.
I really Appreciate your Review. 
1. When You Click on "Location & Weather" the Process is Depends on GPS Information & your Network. So Try It in this way: Turn ON GPS & then Select this Option after 1 minutes.
2. Please Use 'Send Report' Option Or Email me For any Crashes.
- GeeksEmpire

title: That's one

author: Fan Moses
comment: I am using Xperia Z Ultra KitKat 4.4.4. It works on my Z Ultra, but I compare it with a real genuine compass, and both show different direction. I have also tried to recalibrate my device itself, and Reset Sensor option on this app. The direction there's still having slight differences in degree. For my knowledge, real compass might also get obstruction like nearby magnetic fields, house wifi radiation etc. I went down to my block lobby to test out both, there's still slight inaccuracy with both.
